title: Searching for Meaning in the Life of Ellen Johnson-Sirleaf: A Call to Meaningful Responses to Tragedies - PMC

quotes: In 1956 she married James (Doc) Sirleaf (who was seven years older than her).
She had four sons in quick succession between 1957 and 1961 and became a housewife or homemaker (Bourlin, 2013; Cooper, 2017).
In 1961, upon her return to Liberia, she initiated the divorce process as she had suffered domestic abuse from the start of her marriage.

organizations.name: Madison Business College
quotes: where she earned an accounting degree from the Madison Business College in Wisconsin.

roles.title: housewife or homemaker
quotes: She had four sons in quick succession between 1957 and 1961 and became a housewife or homemaker (Bourlin, 2013; Cooper, 2017).

Despite feelings of entrapment and domestic abuse, she travelled with her husband to the United States of America (USA), where she earned an accounting degree from the Madison Business College in Wisconsin.
